alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 1:36PM EST until January 10 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 1 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously low wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches across FAR southern portions of the county with 1 to 3 inches elsewhere. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Jefferson county. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 1 AM to 1 PM EST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult near the Tug Hill. The hazardous conditions could impact this evenings commute. The dangerously low wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 15 minutes.
info.instruction: This is a potentially dangerous situation to be outdoors. If you must be outside, be sure to cover all exposed skin. Frostbite can occur in 15 minutes or less with apparent temperatures of 25 below zero or colder. Periods of snow will result in snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Slow down and use caution while driving. Submit snow reports through our website or social media.
